snippet: An online calculator meant to help doctors assess treatment options appears to overestimate risk, so much so that it could mistakenly suggest that millions more people are candidates for statin drugs.
abstract: Deep flaws are discovered in online calculator meant to help doctors assess risks and treatment options in light of sweeping new guidelines for lowering cholesterol, potentially causing doctors to mistakenly determine that millions more people are candidates for statin drugs; revelation is major embarrassment for the American Heart Association and the American College of Cardiology, which provided the guidelines.
lead_paragraph: An online calculator meant to help doctors assess treatment options appears to overestimate risk, so much so that it could mistakenly suggest that millions more people are candidates for statin drugs.

headline.main: Risk Calculator for Cholesterol Appears Flawed
headline.print_headline: Risk Calculator For Cholesterol Appears Flawed
